content:
The Dolmen de San Juan de Gaztelugatxe is a megalithic monument located on an island off the coast of Bermeo in the Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve. To reach the dolmen, visitors must first climb a staircase with 241 steps leading to the top of the island where the dolmen is located. The staircase offers stunning ocean views and is surrounded by striking landscapes, which makes the climb an enjoyable experience for visitors. 

Visitors must purchase tickets to access the staircase, and it's recommended to purchase in advance to avoid queues. There are guided tours available for those who want to learn more about the history and significance of the Dolmen de San Juan de Gaztelugatxe. The guides are knowledgeable and provide visitors with interesting facts and historical information about the site. However, the tours are conducted in Spanish and Basque, so it's best to check in advance if there are any English language tours available.
